header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Driving, obesity, religion, genes, jigsaws, allergies, surgical operation, money

body.u: how are you gonna do with your driving test then?
are you gonna do a crash course?
huh? Well I don't know er depends on the job doesn't it?
well won't be thinking about it until my foot's better anyway
I mean those crash courses are quite good but the trouble with that is if you don't get the driving experience and then you don't do any driving until you come back
you know cos driving is practise
it's like riding a bike you know
mm yeah well I might get a licence in Oman if we ever get to Oman
that was the plan but I wanted to get just a bit of practice first
what's happened about work? Anything? Have you heard anything?
um no we've been talking to the guy in London and we're basically saying now look we need an answer do they still want us? Yes or no hmm
um they have to tell us they can't keep us hanging on like this
erm but now he he was supposed to phone us today but he never phoned
well maybe he phoned after we left
I dunno well it's their weekend now cos they've got the weekend Thursday Friday
so we weren't hear anything until Saturday
but then the guy in London doesn't work on Saturday
at the earliest but then he doesn't work Saturday
oh for crying out loud it's just waiting and waiting
so Monday but I think we should start looking for other jobs to be honest
well yeah I've started looking yeah
it's just annoying the amount of time and effort we put into it and the money as well doing all the paperwork
yeah yeah no that's not on is it
mm to treat you like that
so we could have I mean we had every job interview we had we got offered the job
mm so we had I mean we had five jobs basically that we could have taken and we told four of them no to take this one and now this is the one that's huh done us in hasn't it
but there's nothing that you can do about it
Cos the longer you're out of work then the harder it is getting back isn't it and it's just
you know I was we were both quite hot when once we left and now you start forgetting things don't you?
I know you remember it straight away again but it's just that
that's a big old leaf isn't it
I was putting that straight in there
what did you get Helen again?

they're good those plants two pounds twenty-five and a erm bottle of wine

yeah I went in the supermarket for wine and then the little shop for the plant
they had them all out there yeah
yeah they've got some nice ones there and that's where I just bought ours from
Cos Claire and I were supposed to go halves on a present but we couldn't find anything in Dereham so

and for her to choose something that she wants only her maybe some clothes or something cos she I think she wants some clothes
because any money she gets she just
gotta spend it down the pub haven't you
mm they're lovely my friends see but they're so far is quite far away really

from And you come to the little village of
really beautiful little church out there
it's really old thirteenth century I used to do concerts there yeah
what er fromage is over there we got

let's hope it tastes good darling
thank you darling hmm what's that?
so mum and dad have gone out tonight
ah cos of what cos you're out?
ha ha no they planned yesterday we were invited as well but it's now our little chance with the car isn't it?
lovely yeah thank you yeah after you
yeah yeah they're picking it up tomorrow morning
we won't have the car again now
that's just the thing innit well you've got to get the use out of it innit hey?
you've paid for it use it
we've got to get the practise in as well
you haven't got Bluetooth on your phone then as well ?
ha ha I haven't got anything on my phone it's an antique
I think it's just about got text on it
so they've got the same one that we've got darling you know the car that we had when mine was written off?
well that was nice wasn't it
yeah mm they've got the satnav er Bluetooth
oh it's got everything I think it's got erm oh what do you call it? Drive
but I didn't I didn't use that
I I didn't even look where it was
especially on long journeys all you do is when you get to the speed you wanna cruise at like sixty you just press the button and take your foot off
yeah but I just wanted to practise
mm yeah that's a good fuel saver
that's that's what the benefit is yeah it's not just for your comfort
it it saves fuel because it will keep the engine going at
hmm but what do you do if you suddenly need to do something?
whatever you touch if you touch the clutch or the brake
and then you press R resume
you get back up to speed you press resume and it takes over again
and if you find you're doing just that little bit too fast you know and you keep creeping up to traffic you just minus it a little bit
and it's like or if you wanna increase slightly you just plus it a little bit and it takes it up in two mile an hour increments
it's ideal isn't it cos he he uses it a lot doesn't he in that journey
and you've only got to go up to sixty-five seventy and your petrol consumption goes whoosh doesn't it
you fuel count yeah it doubles yeah
yeah I've heard that before once you go above sixty
oh yeah it's er your right foot controls you're your right
I'll tell you that next time
I used to teach people how to do that on the Road you know when I worked down at ? At 's place
at the Road And you could just sit there and you could watch what was hap happening to your fuel
by maintaining the same speed you could half the fuel consumption
just by getting up to speed and then take your foot off the s accelerator very very slightly
not enough to slow the car down but you watch the fuel consumption drop cos you're not holding it on all the time
yeah it's er it's a clever technique
mm we'll have to remember that when we're in the middle of the desert
well we've gotta practise with a four wheel drive for that

I thought or er it hasn't changed

they do say to people that you know especial really obese people they're saying if you don't lose the weight we'll not operate any more we won't operate
it the risk is too great

and she's not eating as much as she was?
that's the that's the thing with that there's two types of people that can get obese isn't there?
I didn't think they were I didn't think that they were able to eat excessively
no I thought that was the point wasn't it?
Cos that's what happened to wasn't it? She's I mean cousin she's gone
you've probably never saw her cousin
she's gone from whoof I mean I mean whoof
she was big like a gross American
er you know I mean you know it's about as big as it can get I don't think you'd ever I can't think I can't see anybody getting any wider than that
but she's now smaller than trim er thinner than

but there is two types of people isn't there? There's people that eat an excess just cos they want to but then it changes chemicals in their brain like they're addicted or there's people that just have genetic disorder or something and just can't keep the weight down even if they don't eat much
I think she eats a lot
but I didn't think she would be able to once she had the gastric band
the western world though obesity is through overindulgence
yeah I mean it's ha ha I mean it's MacDonald's
it's like me wasn't it? Putting on all this weight because of going out for for meals
we were going out for meals yeah
and we considered that we were at the good life we can afford it let's do it
you know let's eat out every night
and a bottle of wine here and a bottle of wine there and
well yeah well in lots of parts of Africa having a fat wife is a is a good sign cos it shows you're feeding her well
do you remember our friend in I'm not gonna say his name
there you go I should have used that one on you
we'll have to go to Africa on holiday
our friend in said to me one day we were playing a board game and he went oh you've put on you've put on quite a bit of weight you look really fat
I was like what? And I did get offended but then I did realise afterwards that it was just his culture

yeah he was paying me a compliment and he was like oh I'm really sorry no I didn't mean it like that I meant it the other I meant it in a good way and a lot of the other people around the table just couldn't believe it could they? Their mouths were just like open ah
but at least I understood a bit it was just he'd paid me a compliment even though oh see for me it's not I I wouldn't want oh I don't know
mm I think it's a cultural thing isn't it?
oi you're massive thank you very much
bless him he just wouldn't stop apologising afterwards
and in all fairness I did get quite large though

it's like my friend erm she keeps telling me about this cancer business how you'll get over this you will it's not like Pat I mean Pat had that for twenty odd years she had to have problems for twenty odd years and you know she survived it until it was too late sort of thing they couldn't do any more thank you
I really don't wanna hear about
it just slips out the wrong way?
yeah she's she's tact Yeah she is
she's a very funny woman she is absolutely tactless she never gets a joke does she?
well she says she doesn't but I'm still not sure
I couldn't remember any of those jokes you told me from your phone can you text them to me cos there was the two that I really liked weren't there
and I was trying to think of them
er but I haven't I just can't I haven't no memory for the jokes
well when we tell a joke at the table where you know we'd be up the Trowel and Hammer you know where they have music nights up there everybody's roaring up laughter
and now they've got rid of them
her as well and then suddenly she'll have stopped and her partner will say to her You didn't get that did you? And she says No
and then about it's usually about an hour later isn't it she'll say Oh yeah I get that now
I know she does drive you mad but the amount of people who've said oh you've got tomato down your shirt
lots of people have said that?
some people say that I've got tomato down my shirt
you'll be fine you'll you'll get this you know you'll beat it you're a strong person and then they go on to tell you about somebody else who died you know
yeah well I suppose people wanna think of an association
make you feel like you've got something in common
but they they don't think of the consequences of what they're saying
well Sally text me yesterday and said that she was watching some or listening to something somebody on the radio who said that you should take aspirin to stop it spreading
mm that was on the news recently wasn't it?
just sort of ah that's what she was listening to yesterday or the day before
but there's something every day isn't there?
yeah if that was a if that was a fact doctors would be prescribing it for you
you know that comedian on the telly er you know what I mean? He was so right that Dara O'Brian O'Briain
you know he said you know all this homoeopathy?
and all this sort of thing he said is that water?

and yeah yeah and he says he says let me tell you all these old age remedies and grandmother's remedies he said what the scientists and doctors did at the turn of the century they checked all these things out all the ones that worked they called them medicine
and he said all the other stuff he says is mumbo jumbo
but a lot of them are placebo
if you believe that it you know any kind of medicine's going to work then it's gonna help you

all these footballers have been saying and tweeting like pray for Muamba and have been scoring goals and then lifting up their shirts and it says pray for Muamba
well they had a big debate
well they didn't do that for my cousin who died
they didn't do that for my cousin that died

well exactly there was a good debate on radio two the other day about prayer and
or leaving it up to the medicine and the good people at the NHS who were helping

well I've got some tablets they're not actually tablets they're little tiny weenie things I don't know how big I'm trying to think of som you know something that's as big anyway got them from his herbalist
and opposite Jarrolds and they're for anxious panic attacks and worry
and what happened I he gave me a few pardon me and if I don't take any if I don't put any under my tongue you just put them under your tongue and let them dissolve they're little weenie weenie things
and if I don't take them I'm usually awake about six o'clock ain't I?
half past five six o'clock if I do take them then I'm usually asleep till seven half past seven

really stick my finger in it

and it makes me so angry when they run out onto the pitch and they do all this like Catholic you know ha ha they don't even know what it represents I'm sure they're just doing it for the cameras
well some of them and then when they score a goal they thank God
you know as if God is gonna ha oh I want that player to be you know score against that team

I mean how selfish like it's pathetic

that there's some divine being there
I think it's insanity it really is
why did you get hit by the truck? Well it's God's will
well it's everybody's everybody's own belief it's like going to a erm grave
some pe people believe that going there they can talk to their loved ones

so there's no point in me going to that grave
if they grass it over as long as you know they've got a headstone that's lovely they've grassed it over so that you can keep it tidy
I believe that my mum is here
constantly so I don't need that comfort
you know it's the same as belief in God some people I do believe in God personally
but I wouldn't spout it off
because it's my belief it's not I'm not trying to mm you know turn your mind to my way of thinking
mm no no no yeah yeah
I think religion reincarnation right reincarnation though is it is there you're a reincarnation of me
you know you're my genes follow on
that's right so tha that really is this thing about reincarnation and the why it's so important I think if you're a a decent person not somea not particularly godly but a decent person
you are remembered by your offspring and your generations ahead of you
they remember you with affection because you were good
if you were evil they wouldn't wanna know

yeah but not not with affection
no with admiration a lot of people
I mean look at Hitler and how many people admire Hitler
I mean he still gets talk

you'll live you'll live forever with because has got the same smirk as you when he's right
and that really you know it irritates him to death but he's got it
let me see it say something you know is true
what when it's like the million dollar question on TV
and and I spout it out alexander the Great and they're all they're all debating it and he comes up and the answer is Alexander the Great and I can't help but go

so I said Yeah I'm her mum and she said I knew you were as soon as you smiled I thought that's
but somebody totally I didn't know
thought I was Kathryn's paren well relation
we even looked at each other in the mirror and we can't see the the likeness at all but the amount of people that say is er identical to me
it is the expressions that give it away mostly
it's not the physical features it's the expressions that you have
well you're your mum's daughter to a tee

no but your brain's more like your dad

yeah I don't know I definitely notice things about my mum

yes is a lot more like my mum
but you're like peas in a pod to look at

they think his staff is buried
it's the one over there now

you know they call it Saint Saint Paul's Cove that's where he came ashore
after his ship well I think his ship was shipwrecked or something
you know all those sort of things were factual because they were documented it you know and all the dates fit in

well there are er yeah they catch on fire

well the old the Old Testament is er
